american.text: here are many witty men whose brains can’t fill their bellies.
When a man moves from nature, his heart becomes hard.
True peace between nations will only happen when there is true peace within people’s souls.
Some people are smart but not wise.
You cannot purchase friendship—you have to do your part to make it.
Look at your own moccasin tracks before pronouncing someone else’s faults.
Never sleep while your meat is cooking on the fire.
Ask questions from your heart, and you will receive answers from your heart.
It is easy to show braveness from a safe distance.
Even a small mouse has anger.
A guilty conscience is a hidden enemy.
A pearl is worthless as long as it is in its shell.
As you go the way of life you will see a great chasm. Jump. It is not as wide as you think.
Do not change horses in the middle of the river.
Do not pray when it is raining if you do not pray when the sun is shining.
Don’t judge a man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
Don’t judge any man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
Even a small mouse has anger.
Great Spirit, grant that I may not criticize my neighbor until I have walked a mile in his moccasins.
Haste is the mother of inaccuracy.
If a man is to do something more than human, he must have more than human powers.
If it does not kill you, it will bring you happiness.
It is not enough for a man to know how to ride, he must also know how to fall.
It only looks that way.
Life is — not separate from death.
Live and learn, die and forget it all.
Lovely women, lovely quarrels.
Man belongs to earth, earth does not belong to man.
May your life be like a wildflower, growing freely in the beauty and joy of each day.
Never criticize a man until you’ve walked a mile in his moccasins.
No river can return to its source, yet all rivers must have a beginning.
Nobody gets out of the bed to sleep on the floor.
One foe is too many and a hundred friends are too few.
One shower doesn’t make a flood.
Regard Heaven as your father, Earth as your Mother and all things as your Brothers and Sisters.
Tell me and I’ll forget.Show me, and I may not remember.Involve me, and I’ll understand.
The devil goes away and heaven comes to stay.
The lazy ox drinks dirty water.
The river is my brother for it carries my canoe.
The words of God are not like the oak leaf which dies and falls to the earth, but like the pine tree which stays green forever.
There is nothing so eloquent as the rattlesnake’s tail.
Treat the earth well: it was not given to you by your parents, it was loaned to you by your children. We do not inherit the Earth from our Ancestors, we borrow it from our Children.
We always return to our first loves.
We do not inherit the Earth from our Ancestors, we borrow it from our Children.
When all the trees have been cut down,when all the animals have been hunted,when all the waters are polluted,when all the air is unsafe to breathe,only then will you discover you cannot eat money.
When the last tree has been cut down, the last river has been polluted and the last fish has been caught — only then do you realize that money can’t buy everything.
When the earth is hot, the worm stays in the ground.
When the White man wins, it is a battle, when the Indian wins, it is a massacre.
Worms don’t like the robin’s song.
You have to believe in gods to see them.
When the devil goes to mass he hides his tail.
hey who drink beer think beer.
Man is like a banana: when he leaves the bunch, he gets skinned.
If you sing before breakfast, you’ll cry before night.
Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?
here’s no use asking the cow to pour you a glass of milk.
Living in worry invites death in a hurry.
Life is — not separate from death.
Never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
When in charge, ponder. When in trouble, delegate. When in doubt, mumble.
If you are always dwelling in trouble, change your address.
he bad gardener quarrels with his rake.
Lovely women, lovely quarrels.
he cemeteries are filled with people who thought the world couldn’t get along without them.
If men could see the epitaphs their friends write they would believe they had gotten into the wrong grave.
It’s as difficult to win love as to wrap salt in pine needles.
Better a devil you know than a hundred strangers.
In the South they don’t care how close you get, as long as you don’t get too high. In the North, they don’t care how high you get, as long as you don’t get too close.
Don’t put robbers to work in a bank.
Do not wrong or hate your neighbor for it is not he that you wrong but yourself.
Men apt to promise are apt to forget.
For age and want save while you may, no morning sun lasts a whole day.
Man can’t live in this world alone.
alk is cheap but it takes money to buy whiskey.
Gentlemen prefer blonds — but marry brunettes.
When you were born, you cried and the world rejoiced. Live you life in a manner so that when you die the world cries and you rejoice.
A good guitarist will play on one string.
Nobody has ever bet enough on a winning horse.
What a fool does in the end, the wise man does in the beginning.
he devil goes away and heaven comes to stay.
Don’t bite the hand that feeds you.
american.description: Most of us rely on someone else for our means of living (money). However, if we betray the trust that person has placed in us, we could find ourselves without a job and in much trouble.

american.text: It is better to have less thunder in the mouth and more lightning in the hand.
You cannot hide the sun with one hand.
A smile is worth a thousand words.
Cut your losses and let your profits run.
Laughing wife, crying purse.
No matter how hidden a force is, it will attract some kind of resistance.
After all is said and done, more is said than done.
Better to risk a little than to lose the whole.
When pleasure interferes with business, give up business.
If you don’t have a plan for yourself, you’ll be part of someone else’s.
he opportunity of a lifetime is seldom so labeled.
God makes three requests of his children: Do the best you can, where you are, with what you have, now.
Success has many parents, but failure is an orphan.
Never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
When in charge, ponder. When in trouble, delegate. When in doubt, mumble.
If you are always dwelling in trouble, change your address.
Money talks — everything else walks.
In business partnerships and marriage partnerships, oh, the cheating that goes on.
After a rich man gets rich, his next ambition is to get richer.
If it does not kill you, it will bring you happiness.
here are three faithful friends: an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
Don’t measure your neighbor’s honesty by your own.
Honesty is like an icicle–if once it melts that is the end of it.
Better to be safe than sorry.
In God we trust; all others pay cash.
ry the ice before you venture on it.
A tree never hits an automobile except in self-defense.
Loose lips sink ships.
he early bird gets the worm.
he wicked work harder to preach hell than the righteous do to get to heaven.
One finger can’t lift a pebble.
he ones that matter the most are the children.
hose who sleep with dogs gets up with fleas.
he daughter-in-law wipes away what the mother-in-law has seen.
A man chases a woman until she catches him.
You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink.
Don’t put off for tomorrow what you can do today.
Don’t expect. Inspect.
wo’s company, but three’s a crowd.
Old habits die hard.
he first hundred years are the hardest.
It takes two to make a bargain.
Nothing hurts like the truth.
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
american.description: It's better to hold onto something you have rather than take the risk of getting something better which may come to nothing.

american.text: Make hay while the sun shines.
Never criticize a man until you’ve walked a mile in his moccasins.
A leopard cannot change its spots.
Of two evils, it is always best to vote for the least hypocritical.
It’s best to keep your troubles pretty much to yourself.
Don’t allow the grass to grow on the path of friendship.
he way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.
One good turn deserves another.
Bad news travels fast.
he secret of life is not to do what you like, but to like what you do.
he quickest way to double your money is to fold it over and put back it in your pocket.
Observe with the eyes; listen with the ears; shut the mouth.
He who laughs last, laughs best.
oo many chiefs, not enough Indians.
Charity begins at home.
From small beginnings come great things.
he apple doesn’t fall far from the tree.
he road to the head lies through the heart.
Necessity is the mother of invention.
american.description: There are situations in life when we can’t get the things we may need. It is often at these moments when we invent something to solve our problem, which is why necessity is the mother of invention.

american.text: I’d rather have them say "There he goes" than "Here he lies.".
What goes around comes around.
Don’t change horses while crossing a stream.
A crooked cornstalk can have a straight ear.
Barking dogs seldom bite.
Hell and the courtroom are always open.
Haste makes waste.
american.description: When you try to work too quickly, you usually make mistakes.

american.text: A fault confessed is half redressed.
Listen or the tongue will keep the deaf.
Eggs cannot be unscrambled.
You must not enthrone ignorance just because there is much of it.
Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder.
We’ll cross that bridge when we get to it.
All is fair in love and golf.
You can’t unscramble scrambled eggs.
We may give advice, but we cannot give conduct.
Doctor’s faults are covered with earth, and rich men’s with money.
Look before you leap.
american.description: Make decisions carefully. Think about it first.

american.text: When the law is against you, argue the facts. When the facts are against you, argue the law. When both are against you, change the subject.
Every animal knows more than you do.
he rain follows after the forest.
Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage.
Forewarned is forearmed.
he love of evil is the root of all money.
When you throw dirt, you lose ground.
If you make yourself into a doormat, people will wipe their feet on you.
It takes two to tango.
he Pilgrim Fathers landed on the shores of America and fell on their knees; then they fell upon the aborigines.
Buying on credit is robbing next year’s crop.
Better late than never.
american.description: It’s better if you do something later, than not do it at all.

american.text: he best things in life are free.
An ignorant consent is no consent.
When you’re trying’ somethin’ new, the fewer people that know about it, the better.
Don’t count your chickens before they’re hatched.
Scratch my back and I’ll scratch yours.
Letting the cat out of the bag is a whole lot easier than putting it back.
If you can’t beat them, join them.
If you ever find yourself in a hole, the first thin’ to do is stop digging.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
american.description: You will not get sick if you eat fruit/ healthy food every day.

american.text: No news is good news.
Leave well enough alone.
Maternity is a matter of fact, paternity is a matter of opinion.
he rich get richer, and the poor get babies.
Blood is thicker than water.
american.description: This proverb essentially means that family ties are stronger than any other type, using blood as the literal term for a relative (as in you share the same DNA.) A good example of when to use this would be if a family member and a close friend had a disagreement, you might decide that despite being impartial in the argument, you are going to take the side of the family member because ‘blood is thicker than water.’

american.text: Don’t cry over spilled milk.
Don’t make a mountain out of a molehill.
Paddle together, bail, paddle; paddle, bail; paddle towards the land.
An ounce of proof is worth a ton of assertions.
Don’t mistake chicken dung for an egg.
Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
An analyst is only as good as his last idea.
he bad gardener quarrels with his rake.
A miss is as good as a mile.
Variety is the spice of life.
If your time ain’t come not even a doctor can kill you.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
american.description: If someone helps you when you have problems, or you are in trouble, that person is a true friend.

american.text: Unite to move forward.
here are three things that can destroy a preacher, the glory, the gold, and the girls.
Man does not live by bread alone.
he good lawyer knows the law, the clever one knows the judge.
You don’t get what you deserve, you get what you negotiate.
We do not inherit the land from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children.
Curiosity killed the cat.
american.description: A polite way of telling someone to “Mind your own business”. Pay attention to your own life, ignore things that don’t concern you.

american.text: Don’t ignore the small things — the kite flies because of its tail.
Clothes do not make the man.
Lightning never strikes twice in the same place.
A fool and his money are soon parted.
he proof of the pudding is in the eating.
Better a live coward than a dead hero.
he most dangerous food is wedding cake.
Possession is nine-tenths of the law.
Every man is occasionally what he ought to be perpetually
When the bait’s worth more than the fish, it’s time to stop fishing.
No pain, no gain.
american.description: If you don’t work hard, you’ll never achieve your goal.

american.text: Don’t take any wooden nickels.
he length of a conversation don’t tell nothing about the size of the intellect.
You reap what you sow.
american.description: If a farmer plants potatoes, he will get potatoes, not another thing like tomatoes. Therefore, if we do good things we can expect good results, however, is we do wicked things we should expect the consequences.

american.text: Bragging saves advertising.
he simplest things are the most startling.
Always count the cost.
american.description: Before buying or building anything, this proverb reminds us to count the cost. How much will it cost me in money, time and energy?

american.text: One of the greatest labor-saving inventions of today is tomorrow.
Lust never sleeps.
Living in worry invites death in a hurry.
One swallow does not a summer make.
Some will, some don’t, so what!
he unknown is always great.
Don’t put the cart before the horse.
here’s no place like home.
A bad man in Zion City is a good man in Chicago.
You have to take the good with the bad.
You’re never too old to learn.
here are three kinds of people; those that make things happen, those that watch things happen and those who don’t know what’s happening.
here’s more than one way to skin a cat.
Don’t marry without love, but don’t love without reason.
Smith and Wesson or a Colt always beat four aces.
A person who talks about his inferiors hasn’t any.
A malignant sore throat is a danger, a malignant throat not sore is worse.
he pen is mightier than the sword.
When a father praises his son, he flatters himself.
Fooled once shame on you, fooled twice shame on me.
After the feast comes the reckoning.
Professionals built the ‘Titanic,’ amateurs built the ark.
The world is a ladder for some to go up and others down.
Never ask a barber if he thinks you need a haircut.
he truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth.
When the cat’s away, the mice play.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
american.description: When you are in another country, it’s better to behave like the citizens of this country.

american.text: Never lie unless you have to, and if you don’t have a dang good lie, stick to the truth.
he mountains are never so far apart but the animals find one another.
Hindsight is better than foresight.
No matter how bad a child is, he is still good for a tax deduction.
here’s two theories to arguin’ with a woman—and neither one works.
A man who has both feet planted firmly in the air can be safely called a liberal.
If you cut down the trees you will find the wolf.
If men could see the epitaphs their friends write they would believe they had gotten into the wrong grave.
he spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.
Love is blind.
american.description: If you love someone, you don’t notice his or her faults. You think they’re perfect.

american.text: Bulls make money and bears make money, but hogs just get slaughtered.
he frog does not drink up the pond in which he lives.
In unity there is strength.
You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
Don’t judge a man until you’ve walked in his boots.
An ounce of discretion is worth a pound of wit.
One man’s gravy is another man’s poison.
Borrowed wives, like borrowed books, are seldom returned.
All that glitters is not gold.
american.description: A regularly used proverb, this talks about things not being as good as they first appear. For example a person might dream about living in the huge mansion at the end of the street, but in reality the cost of running that mansion is a whole other set of problems, the house might look amazing but in truth it isn’t as great as it first appears.

american.text: he first step is always the hardest.
Abuse is like a god that destroys his master.
Rome wasn’t built in a day.
american.description: The most important things in life take time. Don’t be in a hurry.

american.text: If you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
Never miss a good chance to shut up.
Boys will be boys.
Don’t bite off more than you can chew.
american.description: Be aware of your limitations, don’t try to do something you know you can’t. It’s ok to say you don’t know.

american.text: he grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.
If you’re riding ahead of the herd, take a look back every now and then to make sure it’s still there.
he squeaking wheel gets the oil.
It is bad luck to fall out of a thirteenth story window on Friday.
Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
Might makes right.
Where there’s smoke, there’s toast.
A whistling girl and a crowing hen never came to a good end.
Hunger finds no fault with moldy corn.
Gold is where you find it.
The wicked work harder to preach hell than the righteous do to get to heaven.
The first hundred years are the hardest.
He who marries a widow with three children, marries four thieves.
You can’t steal second base with your foot on first.
A liar will steal and a thief will kill.
Excuses are merely nails used to build a house of failure.
Widows weep but they look for another husband.
Drink and frankfurters for a dime; kill a man before his time.
A guilty conscience is a hidden enemy.
There’s no advice like father’s — even if you don’t take it.
For our sins God has created three enemies for us: mice in the house, the fox in the mountains, and a priest in our village.
Nobody gets out of the bed to sleep on the floor.
Years know more than books.
Mothers raise their daughters and let their sons grow up.
Do not change horses in the middle of the river.
The love of evil is the root of all money.
True peace between nations will only happen when there is true peace within people’s souls.
Be first at the feast, and last at the fight.

No river can return to its source, yet all rivers must have a beginning.

Light in the streets, shadows in the house.

The mountains are never so far apart but the animals find one another.
The rain follows after the forest.

Don’t allow the grato grow on the path of friendship.

The river is my brother for it carries my canoe.
Don’t judge a man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.

After dark all cats are leopards.
Two cats will not live together in one sack.
What the people believe is true.
The cemeteries are filled with people who thought the world couldn’t get along without them.
There are three kinds of people; those that make things happen, those that watch things happen and those who don’t know what’s happening.
All poor people ain’t black/ and all black people ain’t poor.
There’s no use asking the cow to pour you a glass of milk.
Hens perched on top will shit on those below.
The very time I thought I was lost, my dungeon shook and my chains fell off.
The sound of a church bell at times has more effect than a sermon.
Before borrowing money from a friend decide which you need most.
Live and learn, die and forget it all.
If you ask a Negro where he’s been, he’ll tell you where he’s going.
Knowledge is rooted in all things – the world is a library.
The good lawyer knows the law; the clever one knows the judge.
The secret of life is not to do what you like, but to like what you do.
Old love and wood will burn as soon as they get the chance.
New churches and new bars are seldom empty.
The more sins you confess, the more books you will sell.
The devil goes away and heaven comes to stay.
He who prays a lot is afraid of something.
Listen or your tongue will keep you deaf.
The good lawyer knows the law, the clever one knows the judge.
When the white man wins, it is a battle.
All poor people ain’t black, and all black people ain’t poor.

Fish or cut bait.
If you are going to die you will die in the dark even if you have been in the candle business.
Try the ice before you venture on it.
The rich get richer, and the poor get babies.
When the last tree has been cut down, the last river has been polluted and the last fish has been caught — only then do you realize that money can’t buy everything:
The customer’s always right.
There are three things that can destroy a preacher, the glory, the gold, and the girls.
Defeat is a tonic to a brave man.
There are three faithful friends: an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
In business partnerships and marriage partnerships; the cheating that goes on.
There is no defeat except from within.
Become famous, then go to sleep.
Romance– without finance- don’t stand a chance.
He who lives on illusions, dies of disillusion.
A lean agreement is better than a fat judgment.
There are two sides to every story — and then there’s the truth.
God writes on crooked lines.
The daughter-in-law wipes away what the mother-in-law has seen.
The tiger crouches before he leaps upon his prey.
Those who sleep with dogs get up with fleas.
Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
It is better to be safe than sorry.
There are many witty men whose brains can’t fill their bellies.
Good fences make good neighbors.
The ones that matter the most are the children.
The most dangerous food is wedding cake.
Hope is the nurse of misery.
Man is the only animal who can be skinned twice.
Old age is ripeness.
Man is greater than the tools he invents.
Talk is cheap but it takes money to buy whiskey.
An American will go to hell for a bag of coffee.
Put your money where your mouth is.
Every man has one black patch, and some have two.
By the yard, life is hard. By the inch, it’s a cinch.
Praise makes a bad man worse.
Our faults irritate us most when we see them in others.
Many speak much who cannot speak well.
The baby who doesn’t cry isn’t nursed.
Some families are like potatoes — all that’s good of them is underground.
here are two sides to every story—and then there’s the truth.
If it don’t seem like it’s worth the effort, it probably ain’t.
Self-help is the best help.
If slavery isn’t wrong, nothing’s wrong.
Money does not grow on trees.
he real owners of the land are not yet born.
Good things come in small packages.
Human nature is the same all the world over.
If you eat a live toad first thing in the morning, nothing worse will happen all day long.
Don’t put all your eggs in one basket.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
american.description: Have you ever been separated from your loved one for a long time? You probably spent more time than normal thinking about them, which made you want to see that person even more.

american.text: A friend who shares is a friend who cares.
Buy on the rumor; sell on the news.
One who cannot respect himself cannot respect another.
A man is known by the company he keeps.
he bigger they are, the harder they fall.
One foot is better than two crutches.
he tiger crouches before he leaps upon his prey.
Love makes the world go round.
Cunning men deal in generalizations.
here is no honor among thieves.
Buy low, sell high.
Do as I say, not as I do.
hose above are going down, those below are going up.
he more sins you confess, the more books you will sell.
Don’t judge a book by its cover.
american.description: This proverb is also called a metaphor, to teach us not to judge another person by the way they look on the outside.

american.text: he sound of a church bell at times has more effect than a sermon.
wo heads are better than one.
When you see gossamer flying, be sure the air is drying.
Birds of a feather flock together.
american.description: People who share a common ground will usually be more drawn to one another.

american.text: he only thing we learn from new elections is we learned nothing from the old.
here’s no advice like father’s — even if you don’t take it.
Actions speak louder than words.
american.description: What you do matters – not what you say.

american.text: You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
It takes a heap of licks to strike a nail in the dark.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
You made your bed, now lie in it.
Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth.
Beggars can’t be choosers.
american.description: We use this common proverb when we do not have enough money to get what we want but only what we need.

american.text: Ignorance is bliss.
Misery loves company.
american.description: People who are unhappy want to make others unhappy too.

american.text: After weeks of beans and taters, even a change to taters and beans is good.
Practice makes perfect.
american.description: If you want to be perfect at something, you need to practice every day.

american.text: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again.
You cannot have all chiefs; you gotta have Indians too.
It don’t take no genius to spot a goat in a flock of sheep. (
he road to hell is paved with good intentions.
Where there’s smoke, there’s fire.
Strike while the iron is hot.
american.description: Take action in favorable circumstances because they can change very quickly and it might not be as achieve success.

american.text: If we blame others for our failures, then we should also give others credit for our successes.
Honesty is like an icicle — if once it melts, that’s the end of it.
here’s no fool like an old fool.
Better safe than sorry.
american.description: You should always be careful, even if you think it’s not necessary.

american.text: he cemeteries are filled with people who thought the world couldn’t get along without them.
Use your wit as a shield, not as a dagger.
Ignorance is a form of environmental pollution.
Familiarity breeds contempt.
It never rains but it pours.
A forest is the poor man’s overcoat.
oo many cooks spoil the broth.
Use it up, make do, or do without.
He who hesitates is lost.
he customer’s always right.
While living I want to live well.
I was born on the prairies where the wind blew free and there was nothing to break the light of the sun. I was born where there were no enclosures.
I was no chief and never had been, but because I had been more deeply wronged than others, this honor was conferred upon me, and I resolved to prove worthy of the trust.

I was warmed by the sun, rocked by the winds and sheltered by the trees as other Indian babes. I was living peaceably when people began to speak bad of me. Now I can eat well, sleep well and be glad. I can go everywhere with a good feeling.

Late one afternoon when returning from town we were met by a few women and children who told us that Mexican troops from some other town had attacked our camp, killed all the warriors of the guard, captured all our ponies, secured our arms, destroyed our supplies, and killed many of our women and children… when all were counted, I found that my aged mother, my young wife, and my three small children were among the slain. – Apache song
Skin color makes no difference… My skin is red, but my grandfather was a white man. But why should that matter? It is not the color of the skin that makes me good or bad.
Deeds speak louder than words.
Most of us do not look as handsome to others as we do to ourselves.
What is life? It is the flash of a firefly in the night. It is the breath of a buffalo in the wintertime. It is the little shadow which runs across the grass and loses itself in the sunset.
american.category: crowfoot (1836-1890) warrior and peace-promoting head chief

american.text: I see the universe; I see myself.
When the white man discovered this country Indians were running it. No taxes no debt, women did all the work. White man thought he could improve on a system like this.
May the Warm Winds of HeavenBlow softly upon your house.May the Great SpiritBless all who enter there.May your MoccasinsMake happy tracksin many snows,and may the RainbowAlways touch your shoulder.
A danger foreseen is half-avoided.
Don’t judge a person until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
Don’t judge with the eyes—use the heart instead.
Our first teacher is in our own heart.
Watch out for the man who says nothing and the dog who does not bark.
Treachery darkens the chain of friendship, but truth makes it brighter than ever.
Knowledge that is not used is abused.
Never let things slide: keep steady hold, each upon yourself — do not throw away your life simply to spite another.
Never sit while your seniors stand.
Listen or your tongue will keep you deaf.
Only two relationships are possible – to be a friend or to be an enemy.
Only when the last tree has withered, and the last fish caught, and the last river been poisoned, will we realize we cannot eat money.
One rain does not make a crop.
Tell me who you love, and I’ll tell you who you are.
It is good to be reminded that each of us has a different dream.
Man’s law changes with his understanding of man. Only the laws of the spirit remain always the same.
Old age is not as honorable as death, but most people want it.
One has to face fear or forever run from it.
People’s eyes say words that the tongue cannot pronounce.
Stand in the light when you want to assert yourself.
Stand in the light when you want to speak out.
The eyes of men speak words the tongue cannot pronounce.
The laws of man change, but the laws of the spirit stay the same.
The more you give, the more good things come to you.
The only things that need the protection of men are the things of men, not the things of the spirit.
You already have everything needed to become great.
You already possess everything necessary to become great.

I was the friend of General Custer.  I was one of his scouts and will say a few words. The Great Father in Washington sent you here about this land. The soil you see is not ordinary soil—it is the dust of the blood, the flesh and the bones of our ancestors. We fought and bled and died to keep other Indians from taking it, and we fought and bled and died helping the Whites. You will have to dig down through the surface before you can find nature’s earth, as the upper portion is Crow. The land as it is, is my blood and my dead; it is consecrated; and I do not want to give up any portion of it.

The elders say, ‘The longest road you’re going to have to walk is from here to here. From your head to your heart.’ But they also say you can’t speak to the people as a leader unless you’ve made the return journey. From the heart back to the head.
We will be known forever by the tracks we leave.
Who serves his fellows is of all the greatest.
Good and evil cannot dwell together in the same heart, so a good man ought not go into evil company.
Day and night cannot dwell together.
There is no death, only a change of worlds.
There are many good moccasin tracks along the trail of a straight arrow.
When you have learned about love, you have learned about God.
Take the drowning child from the water before scolding it.
A community that lacks faith in itself cannot survive.
A people without faith in themselves cannot survive.
All dreams spin out from the same web.
All that we do must be done in a sacred manner and in celebration.
All things have inner meaning and form and power.
An angry word is like striking with a knife.
Be good to each other.
Be humble.
Create your community.
Do not allow anger to poison you.
Do not look outside yourself for the leader.
Don’t be afraid to cry. It will free your mind of sorrowful thoughts.
Don’t be afraid to weep—it will free your mind from sad thoughts.
Eating little and speaking little can hurt no man.
Eternal life without suffering was yours all along. Never were you ever separated from the Source.
Everything has form, power, and inner meaning.
If two different bowls both get the job done, then what difference does it make if one bowl is dark and the other is pale?
In age, talk; in childhood, tears.
In death, I am born.
Inside your heart is a tiny place where all knowledge and wisdom resides.
Know the river has its destination.
Know your garden.
Leave your mind and your constant thoughts and return to your heart.
Let go of the shore.
Let no one say negative things about those who are not present.
Let your eyes be offended by the sight of lying and deceitful men.
Like a seed, your future is only beginning to emerge out of the darkness.
Like the spider we must return again to rebuild webs by bringing together threads of our lives — uniting them to divine center within.
Never get involved in someone’s decisions about his belongings.
No answer is also an answer.
Now, look into the Light and breathe deeply the joy of life.
One finger cannot lift a pebble.
Remember who you really are, trust yourself, and open your eyes to the beauty of a new Earth unfolding before you as we breathe.
Rituals must be performed with good and pure hearts.
Sipala (Peace).
Take your children where you go — and don’t be ashamed.
Teaching should come from within instead of without.
The one who tells the stories rules the world.
The rain falls on the just and the unjust.
The rainbow is a sign from Him who is in all things.
The time for the lone wolf is over.
There is never a valid reason for arguing.
Truth does not happen, it just is.
We are all one, brothers.
We are like a string of beads, all united.
We are the ones we’ve been waiting for.
Whatever you need on all levels of your existence is there for you.
When the grandmothers speak, the world will begin to heal.
Wisdom comes only when you stop looking for it and start living the life the Creator intended for you.
Work hard, keep the ceremonies, live peaceably, and unite your hearts.
You are never justified in arguing.
You must live your life from beginning to end. No one else can do it for you.
You must live your life from start to finish; no one can do it for you.
You should water your children like you water a tree.
Let your nature be known and proclaimed.
Let your nature be known and expressed.
Listen to the voice of nature, for it holds treasures for you.
Listen to nature’s voice—it contains treasures for you.

A council fire shall be kindled for all the nations. It shall be lit for the Cherokee and the Wyandot. We will also kindle it for the seven nations living toward the sunrise, and for the nations that live toward the sunset. All shall receive the Great Law and labor together for the welfare of man.
american.category: deganawidah (1500s-1600s) leader who helped found the iroquois confederacy

american.text: A brave man dies but once, a coward many times.
In our every deliberation, we must consider the impact of our decisions on the next 7 generations.
Showing kindness to a stranger is a gift that is always returned..
The greatest strength is gentleness..
Walk lightly in the spring; Mother Earth is pregnant.
Wishing cannot bring autumn glory nor cause winter to cease.
There is no fear when there is faith.
A man or woman with many children has many homes.
A nation is not conquered until the hearts of its women are on the ground. Then it is finished, no matter how brave its warriors or how strong their weapons.
Be satisfied with the needs instead of the wants.
Creation is continuous.
Creation is ongoing.
Do not speak of evil for it creates curiosity in the hearts of the young.
Everything the Power does it does in a circle.
Force, no matter how concealed, begets resistance.
I am standing at the Earth’s center.
If you continue to contaminate your own home, you will eventually suffocate in your own waste.
Inner peace and love are the greatest of God’s gifts.
It is observed that in any great endeavor, it is not enough for a person to depend solely on himself.
Knowledge is rooted in all things — the world is a library.
Many have fallen with the bottle in their hand.
May the Great Spirit walk with you.
No matter how hidden a force is, it will attract some kind of resistance.
See how the boy is with his sister and the other ones of his home lodge and you can know how the man will be with your daughter.
Tell me, and I will listen. Show me, and I will understand. Involve me, and I will learn.
The ones that matter the most are the children.
There can never be peace between nations until it is first known that true peace is within the souls of men.
To go on a vision quest is to go into the presence of the great mystery.
To touch the earth is to have harmony with nature.
Touching the earth equates to having harmony with nature.
True peace between nations will only happen when there is true peace within people’s souls.
We are all related.
When a man moves away from nature his heart becomes hard.
When a man moves from nature, his heart becomes hard.
When we understand deeply in our hearts, we will fear and love and know the Great Spirit.
Grown men can learn from very little children—for the hearts of little children are pure. Therefore, the Great Spirit may show them many things that older people miss.
A man’s life is a circle from childhood to childhood, and thus it is in everything where the power moves.
The center of the universe is everywhere.
The power of the world always works in circles.
For what is one man that he should make much of his own winters, even when they bend him like a heavy snow? So many other men have lived, and shall live that story, to be grass upon the hills.
… A child is the greatest gift from Wakan Tanka.
Pray to understand what man has forgotten.
Seek wisdom, not knowledge.Knowledge is of the past,Wisdom is of the future.
Everyone who is successful must have dreamed of something.
If you see no reason for giving thanks, the fault lies in yourself.
If you see no reason for giving thanks, the fault lies in yourself.
The soul would have no rainbow if the eyes had no tears.
Guard your tongue in youth, and in age you may mature a thought that will be of service to your people.
Remember that your children are not your own, but are lent to you by the Creator.
Life is both giving and receiving.
Listen to her — our Earth, our Mother; listen to what she is saying.
When an elder speaks, be silent and listen.
A good chief gives, he does not take.
From a grain of sand to a great mountain, all is sacred.
What is past is past—it is the present and the future that concern us.
Anachemowegan (Peace).
A man can’t get rich if he takes proper care of his family.
A rocky vineyard does not need a prayer, but a pick ax.
A spear is a big responsibility.
All around me my land is beauty.
Always assume your guest is tired, cold, and hungry, and act accordingly.
Be still and the earth will speak to you.
Before me peaceful, behind me peaceful, under me peaceful, over me peaceful, all around me peaceful.
Coyote is always out there waiting, and Coyote is always hungry.
I am one with the Earth.
I grew up knowing it’s wrong to have more than you need. It means you’re not taking care of your people.
I have been to the end of the earth, I have been to the end of the waters, I have been to the end of the sky, I have been to the end of the mountains, I have found none that are not my friends.
If you want to see what your body will look like tomorrow, look at your thoughts today.
In beauty it is begun. In beauty it is ended.
It’s impossible to awaken a man who is pretending to be asleep.
There is a way out of every dark mist; over a rainbow trail.
There is beauty around me and there is beauty within me.
There is nothing as eloquent as a rattlesnakes tail.
Those who tell the stories, rule the people.
Thoughts are like arrows; once released, they strike their mark. Guard them well or one day you may be your own victim.
We do not inherit the land from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children.
Walk on a trail of song, and all about you will be beauty.
You can’t win them all.
You can’t wake a person who is pretending to be asleep.
You cannot see the future with tears in your eyes.
Every animal knows more than you do.
Talk to your children while they are eating; what you say will stay even after you are gone.
‘Éyewi (Peace).
White men have too many chiefs.
It takes a thousand voices to tell a single story.
No man can think for me.
The earth and myself are of one mind.
I believe much trouble and blood would be saved if we opened our hearts more.
Too many misinterpretations have been made … too many misunderstandings.
I am tired of talk that comes to nothing.
The Earth is the mothers of everyone, and everyone should have equal rights upon it.
You might as well expect the rivers to run backward than to believe that any man who was born free should be contented to be penned up and denied liberty to go where he pleases.
It does not require many words to speak the truth.
american.category: chief joseph (1840-1904) leader known for his integrity and honor

american.text: When we understand deeply in our hearts, we will fear and love and know the Great Spirit.
There can never be peace between nations until it is first known that true peace is within the souls of men.
Sometimes I go about pitying myself, and all the timeI am being carried on great wings across the sky.
Sometimes I go about pitying myself and all the while I am being carried across the sky by beautiful clouds.
Sometimes I go about in pity for myself, and all the while a great wind is bearing me across the sky.
No tree has branches so foolish as to fight among themselves.
When a fox walks lame, the old rabbit jumps.
A starving man will eat with the wolf.
The coward shoots with shut eyes.
Ask questions from you heart and you will be answered from the heart.
Ask questions from your heart and you will be answered from the heart.
Dreams are wiser than men.
He who is present at a wrongdoing and does not lift a hand to prevent it is as guilty as the wrongdoers.
In anger a man becomes dangerous to himself and to others.
It is better to return a borrowed pot with a little something you last cooked in it.
It is easy to be brave from a distance.
It is easy to show braveness from a safe distance.
It takes a whole village to raise a child.
Misfortune happens even to the wisest and best men.
Respect the gift and the giver.
The bird that has eaten cannot fly with the bird that is hungry.
The bird who has eaten cannot fly with the bird that is hungry.
The clear sky and the green fruitful Earth are good; but peace among men is better.
The lazy man is apt to be envious.
The mark of shame does not wash away.
Let us continue to honor that which remains only in dream memory.
To be noble is to give to those who have less. It is an issue of service and leadership.
Service is a spiritual act.
Service is the rent we pay for living, the anchor to our humanity.
You are a servant of the people and the people must come first.
There are no secrets or mysteries—there is only common sense.
We give back thanks to our mother, the earth that sustains us.
We give thanks back to the Sun that has looked upon the Earth with beneficial eyes.
Strive to be a person who is never absent from an important act.
We are friends; we must assist each other to bear our burdens.
All religions are but stepping stones back to God.
Misfortune will happen to the wisest and best of men.
What is past and cannot be prevented should not be grieved for.
Misfortunes do not flourish on one path, they grow everywhere.
What happened in the past and cannot be stopped should not be lamented over.
The smarter a man is the more he needs God to protect him from thinking he knows everything.
Do not wrong or hate your neighbor for it is not he that you wrong but yourself.
Do right and fear no man.
Do unto others as you would they should do unto you.
Each person is his own judge.
A hungry stomach makes a short prayer.
Make my enemy brave and strong, so that if defeated, I will not be ashamed.
See how the boy is with his sister and you can know how the man will be with his daughter.
Give me knowledge, so I may have kindness for all.
Cohqwaivwh (Peace).
A good man does not take what belongs to someone else.
Cherish youth, but trust old age.
I add my breath to your breath that we shall be as one people.
We are grateful to the Mother Earth.
Never sleep while your meat is cooking on the fire.
People seeking a myth will usually find one.
Children are taught to give what they prize most, that they may taste the happiness of giving.
A child believes that only the actions of someone who is unfriendly can cause pain.
Children must early learn the beauty of generosity.
The love of possessions is a weakness to be overcome.
The true Indian sets no price upon either his property or his labor.
Sharing and giving are the ways of God.
Talk was given to the people for good.
You can’t purchase friendship — you have to do your part to make it.
Always look at your moccasin tracks first before you speak of another’s faults.
There is a need for obedience all around us.
When you have a talent of any kind, use it, take care of it, guard it.
The strength of our future lies in the protecting of our past.
He who would do great things should not attempt them all alone.
Every fire is the same size when it starts.
As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
Even as you desire good treatment, so render it.
Before leaving your host, give him a little present—it will serve as a little courtesy, and will not offend.
He who has great power should use it lightly.
Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
The Great Spirit has made us what we are.
The more you ask how far you need to go, the longer your journey seems.
Time discovered truth.
Love one another and do not strive for another’s undoing.
When the wisdom keepers speak, all should listen.
The more often you ask how much farther you have to go, the longer your quest will feel.
Every fire is the same size when it begins.
We are all one child spinning through Mother Sky.
Each person is his own judge.
Show respect for all men, but grovel to none.
Sing your death song and die like a hero going home.
Tenskwatawa has never spoken a lie or an impurity, and never will.
american.category: tenskwatawa a.k.a. he-who-opens-the-door (1768-1834) leader and religious man also known as "the prophet." he was tecumseh’s brother.

american.text: I have been shown how to open the door that has shut us out from joy.
I have been a slave to liquor since first I tasted it—but never again will I drink any.
Never trouble anyone regarding his religion—respect him in his beliefs, and demand that he respect yours.
american.category: tecumseh (1768-1813) shawnee indian chief who led an intertribal alliance that resisted white rule.

american.text: We are made from Mother Earth and we go back to Mother Earth.
It is no longer good enough to cry peace, we must act peace, live peace and live in peace.
Some are smart but they are not wise.
You must always be careful with something that is greater than you are.
A people without a history is like the wind over buffalo grass.
All we wanted was peace and to be let alone.
american.category: crazy horse (1842-1877) determined and fierce warrior and leader

american.text: Always do right. It will give you satisfaction in life.
american.category: wovoka (a.k.a. the cutter) (1858-1932) religious figure of sioux and other tribes

american.text: Be satisfied with the needs instead of the wants.
Be self-loving—go outside yourself and take action. Be peaceful, and be focused on the solution.
Before you choose a counselor, watch him with his neighbor’s children.
Do not only point the way but lead the way.
Friendship is held to be the severest test of character.
Friendship is held to be the severest test of character.
Frogs don’t drink up all the water in the ponds they live in.
Great men are usually destroyed by those who are jealous of them.
I was eager to learn and to do things, and thus I learned quickly.
If a man loses anything and goes back and carefully looks for it, he will find it.
Inner peace and love are God’s greatest gifts.
Is it not better for one hundred to pray for one than for one to pray alone for himself?

It has been said that the position of woman is the test of civilization, and that of our women was secure. In them was vested our standard of morals and the purity of our blood. [For the Native American,] The wife did not take the name of her husband nor enter his clan, and the children belonged to the clan of the mother. All of the family property was held by her, descent was traced in the maternal line, and the honor of the house was in her hands…
Love yourself; get outside yourself and take action. Focus on the solution; be at peace.
Lying is a great shame.
Poverty is a noose that strangles humility and breeds disrespect for God and man.
Prestige is accorded those who give unreservedly.
Silence is the cornerstone of character.
Speak truth in humility to all people. Only then can you be a true man.
The earth has received the sun’s hug, and we shall see the results of that love.
american.category: chief sitting bull (1831-1890) leader and medicine man

american.text: The frog does not drink up the pond in which he lives.
The Indians in their simplicity give away all they have — above all to the poor and the aged from whom they can hope for no return.
The man who preserves his selfhood is ever calm and unshaken by the storms of existence.
The true Indian regards it as an honor to be selected for a difficult or dangerous service.
The true Indian’s generosity is limited only by strength and ability.
There are many good moccasin tracks along the trail of a straight arrow.
There can never be peace between nations until it is first known that true peace is within the souls of men.

Thus she ruled undisputed within her own domain, and was to us a tower of moral and spiritual strength… [Before the arrival of the "white man,"] you could not find anywhere a happier home than that created by the Indian woman. There was nothing of the artificial about her person, and very little disingenuousness in her character.
american.category: ohiyesa a.k.a. charles alexander eastman (1858-1939) physician and writer

american.text: To have a friend, and to be true under any and all trials, is the mark of a man.
To touch the earth is to have harmony with nature.
We see no need for a setting apart one day in seven as a holy day, because to us all days are God’s days.
With all things and in all things, we are relatives.
All things share the same breath – the beast, the tree, the man. The air shares its spirit with all the life it supports.
All things are connected. Whatever befalls the earth befalls the children of the earth.
We are part of the earth, and it is part of us.
Every part of the soil is sacred to my people.
Take only memories, Leave only footprints.
Humankind has not woven the web of life.We are but one thread within it.Whatever we do to the web, we do to ourselves.All things are bound together.All things connect.
The moon is not shamed by the barking of dogs.
Be satisfied with the needs instead of the wants.
They are not dead who live in the hearts they leave behind.
Those who have one foot in the canoe, and one foot in the boat, are going to fall into the river.
Man has responsibility, not power.
Words are the voice of the heart.
The way of the troublemaker is thorny.
God gives us each a song.
God gave us each a song.
Don’t walk behind me; I may not lead. Don’t walk in front of me; I may not follow. Walk beside me that we may be as one.

Earth, Teach MeEarth teach me quietas the grasses are still with new light.Earth teach me sufferingas old stones suffer with memory.Earth teach me humilityas blossoms are humble with beginning.Earth teach me caringas mothers nurture their young.Earth teach me courageas the tree that stands alone.Earth teach me limitationas the ant that crawls on the ground.Earth teach me freedomas the eagle that soars in the sky.Earth teach me acceptanceas the leaves that die each fall.Earth teach me renewalas the seed that rises in the spring.Earth teach me to forget myselfas melted snow forgets its life.Earth teach me to remember kindnessas dry fields weep with rain.
The sky and the strong wind have moved the spirit inside me till I am carried away trembling with joy.
A man must make his own arrows.
When you die, you will be spoken of as those in the sky, like the stars.
Success has many fathers, but failure is an orphan.
After all is said and done, more is said than done.
The opportunity of a lifetime is seldom so labeled.
If yuh ever find yurself in a hole, the first thin’ to do is stop diggin’.
There’s two theories to arguin’ with a woman—and neither one works.
Good judgment comes from experience, and a lotta that comes from bad judgment.
Timin’ has a lot to do with the outcome of a rain dance.
Never ask a barber if he thinks yuh need a haircut.
After weeks of beans and taters, even a change to taters and beans is good.
When you’re trying’ somethin’ new, the fewer people that know about it, the better.
It’s best to keep yer troubles pretty much to yerself, ‘cause half the people yu’d tell ‘em to won’t give a dang, and the other half will be glad to hear yu’ve got ‘em.
The length of a conversation don’t tell nothin’ ‘bout the size of the intellect.
Do not judge a person ‘til you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
Don’t allow yesterday to spend up too much of today.
If you wonder often, the gift of understanding will come.
May our thoughts reach the sky where there is holiness.
An ounce of proof is worth a ton of assertions.
Boys will be boys.
The road to the head lies through the heart.
Silence has so much meaning.
After dark all cats are leopards.
The strong man walks with virtue.
No rogue like the godly rogue.
